org.joonegap
Class GeneNeuralNetCodec

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--org.joonegap.GeneNeuralNetCodec
public class GeneNeuralNetCodec
extends java.lang.Object

Serializes an array of JGAP Genes to and from a JOONE NeuralNet.

This class is not static so that subclasses may override its protected methods.

Method Detail

GenesToNeuralNet

public void GenesToNeuralNet(Gene[] p_genes,
                             NeuralNet p_neuralNet)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
Use the given array of genes to initialize the given neural network.

The structure of the neural network (e.g. how many layers, how many neurons per layer, etc.) is not described in the genes, as this would make the array of genes very 'brittle' (i.e. if those values were even slightly wrong, the network as a whole could not be constructed), and 'brittle' things aren't very suitable for genetic algorithms.

Instead, only weights and bias' are described in the genes, and this function requires an 'empty' neural network (initialized with the desired structure) that it will initialize with weights and bias'.

Parameters:
p_genes - the array of genes
p_neuralNet - the empty neural network
java.lang.Exception

NeuralNetToGenes

public Gene[] NeuralNetToGenes(NeuralNet p_neuralNet)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
Convert the given neural network to an array of genes.

The structure of the neural network (e.g. how many layers, how many neurons per layer, etc.) is not described in the genes, as this would make the array of genes very 'brittle' (i.e. if those values were even slightly wrong, the network as a whole could not be constructed), and 'brittle' things aren't very suitable for genetic algorithms.

Instead, only weights and bias' are described in the returned genes.

Parameters:
p_neuralNet - the initialized neural network
java.lang.Exception

getWeight

protected double getWeight(Gene[] p_genes,
                           int p_iIndex)
                    throws GeneNeuralNetCodec.NoSuchWeightException
Return the weight (or bias) at the given index in the given gene array.

This method is protected because the 'index' is considered to be a 'virtual' property: it could directly reference an index in the gene array, but it could also be a combination of genes from multiple places (after all, synapses in human brains do not have one gene per synapse).

In addition, subclasses can override this method to use a different type of Gene than WeightGene (though JOONE still ultimately requires a double).

Parameters:
p_genes - the array of genes
p_iIndex - the virtual index of the weight (guaranteed never to be less than zero, but not guaranteed to be less than the upper bounds of the gene array)
Returns:
the weight (or bias)
Throws:
GeneNeuralNetCodec.NoSuchWeightException - if the gene array describes no such weight

setWeight

protected void setWeight(double p_dWeight,
                         java.util.List p_listGenes,
                         int p_iIndex)
                  throws GeneNeuralNetCodec.NoSuchWeightException
Store the given weight in the given list of genes at the given virtual index.

This method is protected because the 'index' is considered to be a 'virtual' property: it could directly reference an index in the gene array, but it could also be a combination of genes from multiple places (after all, synapses in human brains do not have one gene per synapse).

In addition, subclasses can override this method to use a different type of Gene than WeightGene (though JOONE still passes a double).

Parameters:
p_dWeight - the weight to store
p_listGenes - the list of genes to store it in
p_iIndex - the virtual index to store it at
Throws:
GeneNeuralNetCodec.NoSuchWeightException - if the gene array cannot store the weight
